prompts: Create a mobile prototype for an "Uber for elderly care" app. Include: caregiver search, caregiver profile (verified), booking, messaging/check-ins, payment, and an emergency button. Match the vibe of the screenshots on this board.
Make the prototype much more senior-friendly: bigger text, fewer steps, clearer primary buttons, and less clutter.
Add the key edge-case screens: no caregivers available, caregiver late/cancels, verification pending, payment failed, emergency triggered.
Create a feature table for an "Uber for elderly care" app with columns: Feature, Who it helps, Why it matters, MVP or Later. Use the critical features listed on this board.
Add a column called "How we'll test it" and fill it in for each feature.
Choose the smallest MVP that still works end-to-end and mark everything else as Later.
Create sticky notes for an "Uber for elderly care" app: user needs, pain points, and product ideas. Group them into clear themes.
Rewrite these stickies to be shorter and more specific. Remove duplicates.
Re-group into: Trust & safety, Booking, Communication, Payments, Emergencies. Highlight the top 5.
Write a one-page product brief for an "Uber for elderly care" app: problem, users, key flows, MVP scope, success metrics, and risks. Use the notes on this board.
Make this shorter and more decisive. Replace vague wording with clear choices.
Add two sections: "Non-negotiables" and "Not in v1".
Create a friendly hero image for an elderly care on-demand app. It should feel safe, calm, and modern, and match the purple style on this board.
Make it simpler and less busy, but keep the same idea.
Make 3 variations: more minimal, more warm/human, and higher-contrast for accessibility.
Draw the end-to-end flow for an elderly care booking app: find caregiver -> book -> caregiver arrives -> updates during visit -> pay -> rate. Include emergencies.
Add the main edge cases: no availability, caregiver cancels, payment fails, emergency happens.
Simplify this to the MVP flow, but keep the safety-critical steps.
Create an ERD for an "Uber for elderly care" app with the core data: users (elder/family/caregiver), caregiver verification, bookings, messaging/check-ins, payments, ratings, and emergencies.
Improve the ERD by adding primary keys, foreign keys, and the right relationship types (1:1, 1:many, many:many).
Simplify to MVP: keep only the tables needed for booking + verification + messaging + payment + emergency, and remove the rest.
Create a mind map for an "Uber for elderly care" app: users, needs, trust & safety, booking, communication/check-ins, payments, emergencies. Use what's on this board.
Expand each main branch with a few concrete examples (not generic labels).
Reduce this to the most important 10-12 nodes and mark the top 3.
Create a 7-slide pitch deck for an "Uber for elderly care" app: problem, users, solution, critical features, trust/safety, MVP, metrics + ask. Use the context on this board.
Make the slides more exec-friendly: fewer words, stronger headlines, cleaner structure.
Add speaker notes with a tight talk track and likely objections + answers.
